examples.description: Downtown snowmelt system using waste heat from a power plant, covering approximately 600,000 square feet of sidewalks and streets. One of the most well-known examples in North America.
Geothermal-heated sidewalks in downtown area using naturally available geothermal energy
Heated sidewalks in underground passages and some street-level areas in city center
